column1: Table 4. Cardiovascular outcome in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).

column7: Increased risk of major cardiovascular event and myocardial infarction.
Increased risk of composite cardiovascular event, myocardial infarction, angina, and revascularization.
PCOS did not increase silent coronary heart disease; PCOS reduced incidence of cardiovascular disease.
No difference in coronary artery disease, cerebrovascular disease, and peripheral vascular disease.

column1: Abbreviations: PCOS, polycystic ovary syndrome; N/A, not applicable. * Baseline.
